{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ectoderm is one of the three primary germ layers in the very early embryo. The other two layers are the mesoderm and endoderm. The ectoderm develops into the skin and nervous system, including the enamel of the teeth. Hunter-Schreger bands, enamel spindles, enamel tufts, and enamel lamellae are all structures found in the enamel of the teeth. Therefore, they are all of ectodermal origin.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
